description: Mauritius has prolonged its curfew order to 1st June 2020. However, some businesses such as hairdressers. hardware stores and fish markets will be granted access to be open after 15th May 2020. Supermarkets will also be allowed to open from 09 00 hrs till 20 00 hrs.
Mauritius has ban on entry to UK travellers. Flights suspended. UK nationals in Mauritius on a tourist visa do not need to extend their “leave to stay” period even if it is due to expire.

Mauritius is extending travel restrictions for a period of two weeks on foreign passengers coming from or having transited during the last 14 days in countries of the European Union, including United Kingdom and Switzerland. Also, as from today 20 00 GMT,  all foreign passengers coming or transiting from Reunion Island will not be allowed to enter Mauritius for the next two weeks. 16/03/2020
Mauritius has begun its Anti-Influenza vaccine especially targeted to elderly people and people with special abilities. The daily programme started from April 5th  from 8:30 a.m to 3 p.m.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: on 5th of May 2020, The government of Mauritius shared an update on the current status of the country as no new case has been reported. Out of the 332 positive cases recorded, 319 patients have been successfully treated and currently, there are only three active cases. Since the beginning of the outbreak in Mauritius, 19 681PCR tests have been carried out. After the launch of the mass testing for Covid-19 nine days ago, 31 305 frontliners have been screened through Rapid Antigen Tests. Covid-19 related deaths stand at ten and 100 passengers are under quarantine.

Dr Zouberr Joomaye  reassured that the country has an adequate number of medical equipment to offer appropriate treatment to the Covid-19 patients. Additional equipment will reach Mauritius by the beginning of April, he announced. Moreover, he emphasised, that there is a sufficient number of ventilators at both the ENT Hospital and New Souillac Hospital and that these hospitals are accordingly well equipped.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: In the last week of March 2020, Mauritius has received 100,000 polymerase chain reaction (PCR tests). In addition, 231 tons of medical equipment has been ordered from China. In view with the shortage of medical equipment around the globe,this measure is to ensure COVID-19 patients are treated with utmost treatment in order to reduce the spread of the virus.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On April 15, Mauritius has received half a million of Hydroxychloroquine tablets from the Government of India. Another consignment from India is in view in the coming weeks.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: RT Knits, a major textile factory in Mauritius has been mass manufacturing reusable cloth masks to be retailed at $1.25. The main aim with the mask is to protect the user as well as others by reducing the spread with the masks being disinfected at high temperatures.

On 5th of May 2020, the Government has retreated that at the time the curfew was declared due to Covid-19, on 23 March 2020, 651 000 surgical masks (disposable masks); 33 750 specialised masks including N95/FFP2; 12 300 gowns; 500 face shields; and 1399 goggles were available as personal protective equipment to the healthcare personnel.

Mauritius set to receive 100 000 PCR tests
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: With the economy going into a dip, Mauritius has come out with a plan for its vulnerable citizens such as a home payment system where pensioners receive their monthly pensions at home in view to curb the transmission of COVID-19. A cut of 20% in electricity bills is also being implemented for some 65,000 households while small enterprises whose electricity consumption do not exceed 125 kilowatts will receive a reduction of 10%.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: A sum of 50% of the Minimum Wage, amounting to Rs 5100 is being given to workers employed in the informal sector. In the same respect, A Special Relief amount for SME having a net profit of less than Rs 50 million, as well as a loan amounting to Rs 1 million is being offered to enterprises with a net profit not exceeding Rs 10 million.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: With complete lockdown in Mauritius, the government has provided essential food packs to needy households as from 26th March 2020. Households who are registered on the Social Register and benefitting from Carer's allowance and the residents of Homes are to obtain these food packs.
type_text: Providing food stuffs to needy people-those who cannot afford to buy additional food items for the lockdown period
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Mauritius is delivering a digitalised Work Access Permit (WAP) to those individuals who have to report to work despite the curfew orders. As of 14th May 2020, some 200,000 WAPs have been delivered with the main purpose being, to allow those who need to travel from home to work.
type_text: WAPs allow those who are requested to report to their work place physically to travel from their residence to work without breaching curfew orders.

description: Mauritius proposes Bill that will provide necessary legal impetus to enforce post-lockdown measures. This includes the mandatory wearing of Mask in public places and gradual return to work. As of now, only people with Work access permit are allowed to work. Workers belonging to this category: public officers, carers, baby-sitters, planters, fishermen and the self-employed may resume work as from 15 May on condition that they are in possession of the proper authorisation.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: As of January 23, passengers arriving to Mauritius inbound from China are quarantined

description:
Under Mauritius' Prevention and Mitigation of Infectious Disease
(Coronavirus) Regulations 2020, initiated on March 20, 2020, a medical practitioner with reasonable grounds to believe that a person may be infected with coronavirus or had contact with somebody infected with coronavirus shall cause the person to be quarantined.

Mauritius is easing down restrictions on lockdown with a slow re-opening of businesses such as hardware stores, hairdressing salons, bakeries, butcher shops, poultry stores along with supermarkets and shops. These businesses will be requiring shoppers with alphabetical order of their surnames to shop at their stores. Wearing of masks and maintaining social distance will be mandatory.

Mauritius is easing down restrictions on lockdown with a slow re-opening of businesses such as hardware stores, hairdressing salons, bakeries, butcher shops, poultry stores along with supermarkets and shops. These businesses will be requiring shoppers with alphabetical order of their surnames to shop at their stores. Wearing of masks and maintaining social distance will be mandatory.

Mauritius is enforcing the policy where in supermarkets, only one person per family is permitted to shop for 30 minutes and shopping time slots have been allocated according to surnames.  It is also mandatory for citizens to wear a face mask and to bring their ID cards while shopping.

Supermarkets and small shops will remain open on monday to friday from  9am to 5pm. To restrict the mass gathering, Mauritius has a enforced a policy on gathering using the alphabetical order of their surnames. For instance, Customers will have to go in alphabetical order as follows:
A-F: Monday and Thursday; G-N: Tuesday and Friday; O-Z: Wednesday and Saturday; Supermarkets closed on Sunday.
